      • InputJPanel

        public InputJPanel(javax.swing.JPanel c,
           RdpJPanel r,
           KeyCode_FileBased k)
        Create a new Input object with a given keymap object
        Parameters:
        c - Canvas on which to listen for input events
        r - Rdp layer on which to send input messages
        k - Key map to use in handling keyboard events

      • InputJPanel

        public InputJPanel(javax.swing.JPanel c,
           RdpJPanel r,
           java.lang.String keymapFile)
        Create a new Input object, using a keymap generated from a specified file
        Parameters:
        c - Canvas on which to listen for input events
        r - Rdp layer on which to send input messages
        keymapFile - Path to file containing keymap data

    • Method Detail

      • addInputListeners

        public void addInputListeners()
        Add all relevant input listeners to the canvas

      • sendKeyPresses

        public void sendKeyPresses(java.lang.String pressSequence)
        Send a sequence of key actions to the server
        Parameters:
        pressSequence - String representing a sequence of key actions. Actions are represented as a pair of consecutive characters, the first character's value (cast to integer) being the scancode to send, the second (cast to integer) of the pair representing the action (0 == UP, 1 == DOWN, 2 == QUIET UP, 3 == QUIET DOWN).

      • getTime

        public static int getTime()
        Retrieve the next "timestamp", by incrementing previous stamp (up to the maximum value of an integer, at which the timestamp is reverted to 1)
        Returns:
        New timestamp value

      • lostFocus

        public void lostFocus()
        Handle loss of focus to the main canvas. Clears all depressed keys (sending release messages to the server.

      • gainedFocus

        public void gainedFocus()
        Handle the main canvas gaining focus. Check locking key states.

      • sendScancode

        public void sendScancode(long time,
                int flags,
                int scancode)
        Send a keyboard event to the server
        Parameters:
        time - Time stamp to identify this event
        flags - Flags defining the nature of the event (eg: press/release/quiet/extended)
        scancode - Scancode value identifying the key in question

      • clearKeys

        public void clearKeys()
        Release any modifier keys that may be depressed.

      • setKeys

        public void setKeys()
        Send keypress events for any modifier keys that are currently down

      • handleShortcutKeys

        public boolean handleShortcutKeys(long time,
                         java.awt.event.KeyEvent e,
                         boolean pressed)
        Act on any keyboard shortcuts that a specified KeyEvent may describe
        Parameters:
        time - Time stamp for event to send to server
        e - Keyboard event to be checked for shortcut keys
        pressed - True if key was pressed, false if released
        Returns:
        True if a shortcut key combination was detected and acted upon, false otherwise

      • handleSpecialKeys

        public boolean handleSpecialKeys(long time,
                        java.awt.event.KeyEvent e,
                        boolean pressed)
        Deal with modifier keys as control, alt or caps lock
        Parameters:
        time - Time stamp for key event
        e - Key event to check for special keys
        pressed - True if key was pressed, false if released
        Returns:
